channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Musk to slow down political spending: 'I think I've done enough'
item.description: The billionaire executive was Trump's biggest donor in 2024. Now, however, he is planning to cut back his spending on politics, he said on Tuesday.

item.title: The world now has its first ever pandemic treaty. Will it make a difference?

item.title: New studies show what's at stake if Medicaid is scaled back
item.description: Researchers studied the health care program's effect on the health of millions of Americans and found tens of thousands of lives were saved.

item.title: In 'Original Sin,' Jake Tapper describes a 'cover-up' of Joe Biden's decline

item.title: Home Depot doesn't plan to raise prices due to tariffs. But some items may disappear

item.title: Italy's Meloni ready to help if Vatican agrees to Trump's war mediation plan
item.description: For now the Holy See says the idea of even hosting talks is more a hope than a concrete plan.

item.title: Creationism still widespread and science educators still alarmed 100 years post Scopes trial
How to safely invest in gold right now
item.description: In the evolving economic climate of May 2025, here are three ways to safely invest in gold right now.

item.title: Three killed after floods ravage French Riviera region
item.description: One couple died after being trapped by rising waters in a resort town; a third victim died in their car.

item.title: Dua Lipa's all-night party at Glastonbury 2024
item.description: The star pop singer caught up with 60 Minutes in her RV the morning after her headline performance and an all-night celebration.

item.title: French paedophile surgeon says he is 'responsible' for deaths of two victims
item.description: Joel Le Scouarnec, who has been on trial since February, has admitted to sexually abusing hundreds of patients.

item.title: British surgeon's 'high anxiety' operating in Gaza
item.description: Dr Rose has been describing life at Nassar Hospital in Gazan city of Khan Younis.

item.title: UK sanctions 'godmother' of Israel's settler movement Daniella Weiss
item.description: The foreign secretary said the move "demonstrates our determination to hold extremist settlers to account".

item.title: More severe weather pummels the central US as thousands recover from deadly tornadoes
